title: List of municipalities in Hordaland, Norway
data: Askøy was established as a municipality 1 January 1838 . Laksevåg was separated from Askøy in 1918 . Most of Herdla was merged with Askøy in 1964
Austevoll was separated from Sund in 1886
Austrheim was separated from Lindås on 1 January 1910 . Fedje was separated from Austrheim in 1947

County capital , is divided into eight boroughs , the only administrative subdivision within a municipality in the county . Established as a municipality 1 January 1838 . Bergen landdistrikt was merged into Bergen in 1877 , Årstad in 1915 , and Åsane , Arna , Fana and Laksevåg in 1972
The municipality of Finnås was divided into Bømlo , Bremnes , and Moster 1 July 1916 . The latter two were merged with Bømlo in 1963
Eidfjord was separated from Ulvik 1 May 1891 . Eidfjord was a part of Ullensvang from 1964 until 1977
Etne was established as a municipality 1 January 1838 . Most of Skånevik was merged with Etne in 1965
Fedje was separated from Austrheim in 1947
Fitjar was separated from Stord in 1860
Fjell was established as a municipality 1 January 1838
Fusa was separated from Os in 1856 . Hålandsdal and Strandvik were separated from Fusa in 1903 , but merged into Fusa again in 1964

Granvin was established as a municipality 1 January 1838 . In 1858 , Ulvik , which used to be an annex to Granvin , became the main parish , and Granvin an annex to Ulvik . Granvin was separated from Ulvik as a municipality of its own 1 May 1891
Jondal was separated from Strandebarm in 1846
Kvam , until 1912 named Vikør , was established as a municipality 1 January 1838 . Strandebarm was merged with Kvam in 1965
Kvinnherad was established as a municipality 1 January 1838 . Fjelberg , most of Varaldsøy and parts of Skånevik , were merged with Kvinnherad in 1965

Lindås was established as a municipality 1 January 1838 . Masfjorden was separated from Lindås 1 March 1879 . Austrheim was separated from Lindås in 1910 . Alversund , and parts of Hamre and Hosanger , were merged with Lindås in 1964
Masfjorden was separated from Lindås on 1 January 1879
Meland was separated from Alversund in 1923 . The northern part of Holsnøy was transferred from Herdla to Meland in 1964
Modalen was separated from Hosanger in 1910 . The middle part of Eksingedalen was transferred from Modalen to Vaksdal in 1964
Odda was established as a municipality 1 July 1913 . Røldal was merged into it on 1 January 1964
section_text: This is a list of municipalities in the county of Hordaland , Norway . Hordaland , until 1919 known as Søndre Bergenhus amt , is divided into 33 municipalities . Traditionally , the county was divided into five districts : Hardanger , Voss , Sunnhordland , Midhordland , and Nordhordland . These districts do not have separate administrations and have no political powers . The municipality and city of Bergen , a separate county until 1972 , is the county capital of Hordaland .
intro: This is a list of municipalities in the county of Hordaland, Norway. Hordaland, until 1919 known as Søndre Bergenhus amt, is divided into 33 municipalities. Traditionally, the county was divided into five districts: Hardanger, Voss, Sunnhordland, Midhordland, and Nordhordland. These districts do not have separate administrations and have no political powers. The municipality and city of Bergen, a separate county until 1972, is the county capital of Hordaland.
